alert.note: Alert for Martin; St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 01 at 3:29PM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Martin and St. Lucie. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 329 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Port Saint Lucie, Walton, Stuart, Indiantown, Jupiter Island, Palm City, Port Salerno, Jensen Beach, Hobe Sound, Sewall`s Point, Witham Field, North River Shores, Nettles Island, Hobe Sound Beach, Jonathan Dickinson State Park, Indian River Estates, Ocean Breeze Park, Rio, Hobe Sound Wildlife Refuge and Waveland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
